meanings.definition: A colony that is part of a larger colony.
meanings.sent1: The ant subcolony worked together to gather food for the main colony.
meanings.sent2: The bird subcolony nested in the tree alongside the main group.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel subcolony decided to throw a tiny party for the main colony.
meanings.sent4: The flower subcolony bloomed brightly, adding color to the larger garden colony.
meanings.sent5: The fish subcolony swam in harmony with the rest of the underwater colony.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms within a larger colony.
meanings.sent1: The bee subcolony was responsible for pollinating the flowers within the hive.
meanings.sent2: The bacteria subcolony thrived in the petri dish among the other microorganisms.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly subcolony decided to host a small talent show for the rest of the colony.
meanings.sent4: The human subcolony worked diligently, contributing to the success of the overall society.
meanings.sent5: The coral subcolony added intricate patterns to the reef, enhancing the beauty of the entire underwater colony.
